meanings.definition: To watch over and direct (an undertaking or group of people)
meanings.sent1: She oversaw the project to ensure everything was on track.
meanings.sent2: The manager oversaw the team to make sure they followed the plan.
meanings.sent3: The teacher oversaw the classroom like a caring guardian.
meanings.sent4: The captain oversaw the crew, guiding them through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The mother oversaw her children playing in the park, keeping them safe.
